question: The most common cause of paraplegia of early onset of Tuberculosis of spine is:
exp: (d)- Early onset paresis is due to inflammatory edema, granulation tissue, an abscess, caseous material. It has good prognosis. Late onset paresis is due to increasing deformity or reactivation of disease, or bony sequestrum, stenosis of the vertebral canal, fibrosis or vascular insufficiency and has poor prognosis.

question: A 35-year-old lady with chronic backache. On X-ray she had a D12 collapse. But intervertebral disk space is maintained. All are possible except:
exp: (d)- Characteristic radiological feature of Pott's spine is obliteration of disk space with destruction of two adjacent vertebrae.- This feature differentiate TB spine from other diseases causing vertebral destruction (like metastasis) in which disk space is preserved.

question: The 1st sign of TB is:
exp: (a)- The earliest feature is loss of curvature due to paravertebral spasm.- The next radiological feature of spinal tuberculosis is reduction of intervertebral disk space and osteoporosis of two adjacent vertebrae sometimes with fuzziness of the endplates.

question: The most common cause of kyphosis in a male is
exp: (b)- Tuberculosis is the most common cause of kyphosis in males. The deformity being maximum in dorsal spine > lumbar spine > cervical spine.

question: In TB spine the first symptom is:
exp: Ans. is 'c' i. e., Pain Back pain is the commonest presenting complaint.

question: Not a feature of TB spine-
exp: Ans. is 'c' i. e., Exaggerated lumbar lordosis Clinical features of TB of the spine o The disease is commonest in young adults, o The presenting complains are: - Back pain: Commonest and earliest symptom. Initially, pain occurs on sudden movement of the spine. Stiffness of back: Is also an early symptom and occur along with pain. Visible deformity: Gibbus or Kyphosis Localized swelling: Due to cold abscess Paraplagia: In neglected cases Constitutional symptoms: Evening fever\ loss of appetite, night sweat, loss of weight. o On examination, following findings may be seen: - Decreased range of motion. Local tenderness: Over the spinous process of the affected vertebra. Deformity: - Cervical spine: - Straight neck with loss of cervical lordosis. Thoracic: - Gibbus/kyphosis Lumbar: - Loss of lumbar lordosis Para-vertebral swelling: - Cold abscess

question: Cold abscess in chest wall is most common due to
exp: Ans is 'a' i. e. T. B spine * Cold abscess is a feature of bone tuberculosis and spine is the most common site of bone TB (about 50%). Rib tuberculosis is very rare. These lines from Tuli further support the answer. "Abcess or sinuses from the cervical or dorsal regions can present themselves far away from the vertebral column along the fascial planes or course of neurovascular bundles. Thus they may present in the paraspinal regions at the back in the posterior/ anterior cervical triangles, along the brachial plexus in the axilla, and/ or along the intercostal spaces on the chest wall. " -Tuli, 2/e

question: Most common site of TB -
exp: Ans. is 'a' i. e., Spine Skeletal tuberculosiso Tuberculous infection of bone (osteomyelitis) is a form of secondary osteomyelitis caused by hematogenous dissemination from a primary' infected visceral focus. The primary-focus may be active or quiescent, apparent or latent; either in the lungs, lymph glands or other viscera. Tuberculous infection of bone (Tubercular Osteomyelitis) vs Bacterial infection (Bacterial Osteomyelitis). Acute bacterial Infection.
